name: Bethlehem Steel Company v. Unemployment Compensation Board of Review, Appellant. Rusynko Unemployment Compensation Case
name_abbreviation: Bethlehem Steel Co. v. Unemployment Compensation Board of Review

judges: Before Jones, C. J., Bell, Musmanno, Jones, Bok and Eagen, JJ.
parties: Bethlehem Steel Company v. Unemployment Compensation Board of Review, Appellant. Rusynko Unemployment Compensation Case.

opinions.text:
Opinion
Per Curiam,
The court being evenly divided on the merits of this appeal, the order of the Superior Court (reported at 191 Pa. Superior Ct. 434), is affirmed.
opinions.author: Per Curiam,

attorneys: Sidney G. Handler, for employe, appellant.
David G. Harrison, Deputy Attorney General, with him Sydney Reuben, Assistant Attorney General, and Anne X. Alpern, Attorney General, for Unemployment Compensation Board of Review, appellant.
William H. Wood, for employer, appellee.
casebody.head_matter:
Bethlehem Steel Company v. Unemployment Compensation Board of Review, Appellant. Rusynko Unemployment Compensation Case.
January 4, 1961:
Argued November 14, 1960.
Before Jones, C. J., Bell, Musmanno, Jones, Bok and Eagen, JJ.
Sidney G. Handler, for employe, appellant.
David G. Harrison, Deputy Attorney General, with him Sydney Reuben, Assistant Attorney General, and Anne X. Alpern, Attorney General, for Unemployment Compensation Board of Review, appellant.
William H. Wood, for employer, appellee.
